task.summary: Default task
Progress: > Read JSON file correctly using AsyncTask > Display course content with good design with ArrayAdapter class
Progress: > Add attributes "isLab" & "courseDescription" in course class for implementing Dialog in the future when ListView is press.
Made changes in AsyncTask >Instead of parsing hardcoded URL string, now program pass URL string as parameter to AsyncTask

Design: > Implement TabLayout with two tabs linked with two Fragment(CourseFragment, ScheduleFragment) in Main page. > Created custom ToolBar
Backend: > By making MainActivity class more on view manager class, I moved AsyncTask for loading courses from JSON, and storing information on HashMap, into CourseFragment class. CourseFragment class is specifically associated with displaying the courses, so I consider this decision reasonable.
Feature Update: > Made list of courses clickable. If click dialog with course description shows up.

Feature Update: > Made filtering feature, where user can filter courses by core or subject. > Spinner for cores and subjects.
Model Update: > Added new attributes String subject in Course class for filtering purposes.
Design Changes: > Changed the color scheme for this app > Made the filtering option more understandable
Design Changes: > Change color scheme for Dialog

Efficiency Changes in CoursesFragment: > Instead of creating new adapter every time when filtering, I added updateList() method in CourseArrayAdapter class, where adapter simply set new filtered courseList as list in CourseArrayAdapter class.
Handle Dialog button in CoursesFragment class: > It make sense to add selected course to Schedule object in CoursesFragment instead of DialogFragment where they would be destroyed after dismiss()
Communication between CoursesFragment and ScheduleFragment: > Create ViewModel(Observer class) class call "ScheduleObserver", where they would be notified whenever user add/remove course from schedule in CourseFragment, and tell to ScheduleFragment to update UI according to the schedule changes that happen in CourseFragment.
New Feature: > Created hardcoded schedule visualization graph on Schedule tab page. Need to do this dynamically.

Schedule Graph Changes: > User can visualize their pre schedule courses on Schedule tab. > Course that has two class in a day, would be display correctly as well.
Changes on Model: > some of the courses has two class in a day, so changed the attribute of EnumMap<DayOfWeek, Hours> to <DayOfWeek, List<Hours>>.
New Feature: > Time Overlapped detector. Show warning when user pick overlapped classes. > Add/Drop from ScheduleFragment
New Feature: > New filtering for lab and online > cancelled class is visible in list view
Created small feature. clear schedule: > Added clear button on schedule fragment/layout. onClick, it will clear the schedule list, and notify the changes to observer(in this case CourseFragment).
Small Feature: In schedule fragment, total credit will be shown Small Changes: Clear List of warning message every time when updateUI() -> overlappeddetecotro() is call
Change params of updateUI()
Bug fix: > Found mistake in TimeOverlapped function in schedule class. Instead of using "i" as index, it was using hard coded value 1.
Feature Update: > Setup Navigation Drawer
Refactor code for better readability
Implement fragment navigation: > Now user can press the home logo on toolbar to navigate back to main tab page > created Feedback fragment

Code Refactoring: CourseArrayAdapter: > Apply ViewHolder design pattern to improve the efficiency of rendering ListView Dialog, and CourseFragment Class: > Instead of passing huge bundle, add attribute of schedule in dialog class and set it from course fragment
Navigation Working: > More robust and logical code for navigation
Feature: > Added Login feature fragment. Not completed yet

Save Data: > Through CourseFragment onPause() method, it will save the user data(schedule) in internal file storage in android.
ReturnToHome: > return to home method is now more logical.
